justification: “Participants … rated their decision confidence (Type-2 judgment) on a scale from 1 (‘very low confidence’) to 4 (‘very high confidence’).”
“In the ‘Type-2/Type-3’ condition … they provided a confidence rating (Type-2 judgment) on a 2-point scale.”
“… then a metametacognitive rating (Type-3 judgments) again on a 2-point scale (low/high).”
“The method first computes each participant’s metacognitive sensitivity (meta-d′) that quantifies how well confidence ratings discriminate between Type-1 correct and incorrect responses.”
“… we finally computed metacognitive efficiency, meta-d′/d′ or Mratio, to represent the participant’s metacognitive ability.”
“To determine each participant’s Type-1 task performance … we computed the signal detection theory parameter decision sensitivity (d′).”
